review: I have became fan of their Tuscan Hummus served with PITA Bread .. We then ordered a Japanese Eggplant :) Loved the variety and taste ... I would really recommend anyone looking for some change of the regular pizza routine and try something new ... I usually prefer Pan Pizza or thick crust but Loved their THIN crust pizza .. Servers are really helpful and recommend dishes based on your preferences .. Have been to other CPK locations too but this one is amongst the best one being located so close to our place ..

What a big disappointment for that location! I have been going there for years (used to be kids friendly too) and used to love to go there with my girlfriends for a light lunch with friends and family in the evening. They had a nice menu for kids. Well, it all changed on November 2011. we took our little girl there for her birthday (her request) told the hosted it was her birthday, when I noticed the our server was a little off...he did not offer a drink with the kids meal, bread was stale like it has been sitting in the refrigerator for days (I would not give it to my guests). I approached the server to let him know it is my daughter's 6th birthday...nothing...he had at least 5 people with him to sing to a table by us but only brought an ice cream for her (did not ask me what I wanted) and said "happy birthday sweetie"... just him ....not even her name...I believe it is under new management (at least I hope that will explain it) but it was just bad. I have not been back ever since...I prefer to spend my $50.00 on other chain restaurants such as cheese cake factory where I get good service and good food. I even sent a respond to their corporate office back in November and did not hear back...oh well.
Do the carnitas tacos with the habanero salsa!   Awesome!

First I'd like to thank Frederick my waiter,  and Danielle the manager for great service.   Now for the food review, I ordered the barbecue chicken salad and it must have been years since I ordered it because it was not how I remembered it.  First there was barely any chicken, beans or corn mostly finely chopped iceberg lettuce which would explain why I was eating water.  Secondly, the chicken appeared to be boiled then cut into small pieces and marinated in BBQ sauce.  Who remembers when this salad was tossed and filled with yummy chunks of tasty chicken, tons of beans and corn?  Never will I order this or any salad if their new philosophy is to portion control only and not taste.  I ordered from the kids menu the pasta and pizza...not bad.  A dollar for a nice size serving of fruit that was tasty.  The best items on the menu were the strawberry lemonade and the spinach artichoke dip.  But, one thing to mention and yet again CPK is messing with perfection.  The spinach dip used to come with a sour cream and salsa side...no longer, that too will cost you a dollar for each.  My normal eat(s) is the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine but I have to tell you I am scared to order it for fear that that too has changed for the worse.

If I could give this place 0 stars, I should would. Or even better, a - 5 star rating is what they deserve. Had a terrible experience when picking up a phone order. First, upon arrival was not greeted properly. After paying for our order and tipping the attendant, she said that the order will be ready shortly. 15 minutes later we were still sitting and waiting for a simple SALAD that was ordered half an hour prior our arrival over the phone. Nobody came to check on us or give us an update on the order. 20-30 min go by after the point we have been told the order will be ready shortly and I go and ask what the status is. The girl who processed the order lets me know that the salad has been taken by a waiter by mistake and that they will make a new one. SERIOUSLY?! And you couldn't come and apologize for the wait?! I ask to speak to a manger and when a lady comes and I explain the rudeness of her employee she has an even worse off attitude. What is wrong with these people?! Never eating at that place again! Didn't even offer a free appetizer or an apology for the mistake... I love CPK but this location is a major NO NO

I love eating here. The food is fresh and there are always plenty of healthy choices. You are always greeted with a smile when you arrive and when you leave. I love the unique bar seating where you have full view of the kitchen making the pizzas or a clear view of the flat screen television. It's a great place for a quick lunch because the food comes out pretty quick but still fresh ingredients. Very hard to do and cpk does it well.  Also, the curb side is soooo convenient when I'm having a cpk craving but I want to stay in my pajamas to get it. It can get quite crowded but the wait is never more than I can handle, and I am an impatient person. Marina del Rey is the best.

I went into CPK this afternoon to pick up a lunch order (previously called in) The service was wonderful.  Fast, polite, my order was correct with the "extras", the young man behind the counter (I wish I could remember his name) was extremely professional and I felt well taken care of.  The food was great and it was ready moments after I walked int the door.  The only negative about the experience was that the complimentary bread may have been a little dried out- other than that, everything was great.

My friend got me to enter a chain restaurant! Ahhhh! The food: Tortilla "spring rolls" - Basically rolled quesadillas with too much cheese. The difference between the three flavors was overpowered by the cheese. I don't get how these are spring rolls in any context... Decent quesadillas. Avocado club egg rolls - Weird hybrid of a BLT sandwich stuffed inside wonton wrappers. Not a big fan of deep fried avocados -- a bit conflicting. Chopped salad - Iceberg lettuce with salami and basil! I guess they do best with simple here. Wild mushroom pizza - Generous amount of four different types of mushrooms. I think it desperately needs some acidity though. Marinara or pepperoncinis? Cranberry cooler - Club soda with a splash of cranberry juice. And apparently asking for just cranberry juice refill gets charged again as a separate drink. Wtf?? Atmosphere was nice, but packed with kids and college kids discussing the day's afternoon hangovers. Waiter wasn't the most attentive nor very friendly. Generically awesome. A bit overpriced as well. A good reminder as to why I stay away from major chain restaurants. Go, CPK!

Off to a great start when we walked in the door and were greeted by a very friendly hostess with a big smile and "Ill be right with you!" Waiter was also very friendly and informed about the menu - his name was Mo - and we didn't wait long at all for our food. They have a "smaller bites" menu, sort of like tapas, which was perfect bc I wasn't too, too hungry. I had Korean Beef Tacos, which were good - not amazing - arugala salad - very good - and corn guacamole - very good. The BF had a pizza with veggies, sundried tomatoes, onions - VERY good. The whole things came in under $40 for the two of us with a beer. Nice warm atmosphere and very friendly service. Thumbs up.
Service was good....Pizza is what you expect from CPK...fresh and tasty salads... Parking can be a little challenging in the lot.
This CPK is like all the other CPKs.  Service is decent.  It gets very crowded during lunch hours and parking is horrible in that plaza b/c of all the traffic the plaza gets.

Always a good stand by.  Usually hit this (location) 'bout twice a year.  Get seated quickly, lively and bright.  Open kitchen and the service is very very good.  The food, even better - and relatively fast too.  CPK of course has their formula down.  Good spot, for whatever occasion really. The Chipotle Chicken pizza is a real problem.  Not really even a "pizza."  I don't usually get their pizza's either, but this is off the charts yummy.

This place is always good.  Had their trade mark BBQ Pizza and it was great!  I also had the tortilla soup which hit the spot as always.  I could never get any consistency with the free bread they serve at any CPK though.  It seems different in texture each time I visit a different location for some reason.  I also like their Thai Crunch Salad here.
This place is alright, as far as California Pizza Kitchens go. The food is good. The folks that work here are tattooed, somewhat indignant and aggressive.

just Ok.  Sorry but I wish I could say good things about this location but I can't.  Young servers not properly trained.  Leave you for a while don't come back to see if your food is ok or if you need anything until your almost done with the meal.  Last two times they took me to dirty tables that had not been bussed yet.  Lack of leadership I say. Not loving the new menu~need salt and pepper guys really it has no taste. Dessert  yummy chocolate truffle something, Idk but it was good! that was the best thing about my last two visits the dessert

Went there for lunch at the beginning of August, 2012. The pizza was served cold, so we asked to have it heated up. Came back chewy, as if it was a day old. The rest of the meal was equally unimpressive. But it gets worse... On the way back to the car, my buddy realized he that he had left his iPhone on the table. He went back but it was gone. The people at a nearby table said that only the busboy had been by, so my friend went to the managers. They refused to bring out the busboy. It gets worse. Using "Google's Latitude" software and all "Find iPhone", I could see the phone was in the restaurant. The managers still refused to do anything other than hand out their business cards. Oh yeah... they did one other thing: They sent the busboy home. I bet he had the phone with him. My buddy contacted the Corporate office. They gave him the runaround for a month, saying their insurance company would take care of it. Finally, after ignoring all of the calls, the insurance company said that California Pizza Kitchen told them not to pay. I understand that a business can't vouch for all of its employees, but there's no excuse for not being responsible to your customers. In fact, it's disgusting. Another friend left his phone at the Island's in Marina del Rey. Not only was the phone not stolen, the manager tracked my friend down and waited after-hours for him to pick it up. Talk about night-and-day differences.

I was very disappointed after my last visit. I did curbside take out and ordered mac & cheese as well as a cheese pizza with pineapple topping. The mac & cheese was enjoyed, but the pineapple was not baked into the pizza and was instead tasted as though they just threw it on before they put it in the box. Also, I had ben waiting outside for a while and when I received my meal it wasn't even that hot. On the phone when I made my order with the server she clarified that I wanted two sets of silverware and bread, however it was only one of each. I am usually very pleased with CPK but this last visit has me reconsidering if I will come back .

I am not a big fan of CPK, I beleive they are overpriced for what you get. Went on a school fundraiser so it's n ice they participate with groups and help out. The Place was packed, people standing in the parking lot packed. After being seated we ordered some drinks, it took a while, fine they are busy. Chocolate milk took even longer. Went with salds this time because they are tasty and fresh. Wife ordered a hlaf I ordered a whole. When they hit the table they looked almost exactly the same size except for the plate. On e of the expediters assured us they were correct when asked. Al wanted to ask a manager if the whole was twice as big as the half, but was hungry and didn't bother. Tai chicken Salad was yummy, wifey enjoyes the bbq chicken salad. At $9/$14 I think that is expensive. Kids menu here is reasonable priced, $6. They also have dessert for kids for $1, nice. My dessert was a sausage pizza. They make delicious pizzas but they are small for $12+/-. Serv ice was very good despite being busy so tha twas a plus. For a pizza place I think their beer selection is poor and small. Bud Light, Blue Moon, 2 more. They haven't figured out there is a crafte brew thing happenin.

We've been to this location dozens of times over the years but won't be back!  Recently, the music was so loud even the staff was complaining.  I asked the very SURLY manager, Roy Wright, if it could be turned down so we could converse at our table since we were literally unable to hear one another, and he said "no" due to a new "ambient music policy".  Seriously??  He was quite rude and even after calling the corporate offices to ask why loud music was more beneficial than repeat customers, we were told that the new policy was based on research that music was necessary at a certain volume to "energize" the restaurant.  Are you kidding?? Is this why your restaurant is only half full any time we've gone recently? Hey--CPK--good luck on your new policy.  And the good news......the Westside has plenty of other restaurants to choose from.

Really disappointing especially since CPK used to be all about customer service. Bored, lackluster staff - the kind that greet you and engage you while looking over your head at other things they'd rather be doing. Sat for a long time before acknowledgement. Long wait for drinks. Practically ignored for refills. Trash from straw and napkin wrappers sat on table whole time. Slow to clear empty plates. New revamped menu is uninspired an not that tasty. And frankly not a great value. Cpk used to be about great food and great service for a good value. Something ha changed to a lowest common denominator. At least at this one in mdr.
We dine at this location often and are never disappointed.  Ask for Fred's section.  You won't be disappointed.  He is an excellent server-very professional, attentive and efficient.

These guys were good.  The pizza is better than Domino's Pizza of course. They don't take reservations but when we went it was not too busy.  The place is pretty big so they are able to handle big groups. I tried their White Pizza and didn't like it too much.  The Wild Mushroom pizza was pretty good.  And the carnitas pizza was okay.

I have always been a fan of CPK.  They are consistent and tasty whenever I go to one no matter where I happen to be.  In so far as their pizza goes???  I LOVE IT.  Especially the thin crust pizza.  yum yum yum.  As far as chain restaurants go...  This is a really good one especially since you can order healthy options or not so healthy options and always be satisfied.  In the mood for take out? No problem!  They have it under control and make it quick which is usually what you want with take out.  Whether it is take out or eat it, thank you CPK for being so consistent!

I used to LOVE this place.  Looked forward to eating there a couple times a week (sometimes more).  Now I avoid it.  My last visit was about 3 weeks ago.  Over the past few months I've noticed changes in the food.  The limes have no juice.  The pastas have very little sauce (I can boil spaghetti noodles at home!), the flavor is a lot weaker, they no longer bring bread to the table.  Now I understand the economy is not very strong, but they are running away the customers they DO have.   That's not all.  They keep it so COLD in there!  It's so cold it hurts!  I have been taking a jacket with me and still feel like I'm sitting in a freezer while I'm trying my best to enjoy a meal.  I now go to an Italian restaurant nearby instead.  I won't be back anytime soon.  Used to be a 5 star in my book.....now a 2.  Sorry CPK, but you've let me down.

Wow!  They finally changed their bread!  No longer do you get a few slices of cold bread and hard as rock butter.  They now serve WARM bread with a wonderful olive oil/herb mix that is just delicious. The rest of the food was the same old stuff - but still okay.  Our server told us other positive changes are on the way. Check it out!

Re: Marina Del Rey CPK. We go there about twice every three weeks. Recently they have changed their lighting. It is very dim now to the point of being annoying. The manager stated it was a corporate decision. The only other change is the bread they put on the table. It's now a crispy crust sour dough with an herb olive oil dip. Tasty.  They also do not provide butter anymore. The rest of the food is OK but nothing to really rave about. BTW, we had Drew for a waiter and he has a great attitude, unlike some there, and attentive. Big PLUS for him.

You guys suck, service, cramped tight spaces, i literally walked out because it shouldn't take more than 20mins to at least greet us and ask for a damn drink. FAIL! CPK is Sub-par at best but this location is horrible. Sigh i feel better now :)

Been going to different CPK  locations for almost 4 years and i've always gotten the best service! Up until this past weekend -_- Came here to have a nice dinner with my bf but it ended horribly. Worse service i've ever experienced!!!! We were sat in a very small  table which didnt move. My bf was trapped in between our table and someone else's (not enough arm space). Almost 20mins went by and we were never offered any bread while we waited or asked if we wanted anything to drink -_- I counted at least 3 waiters that walked by our table and not one came up to us. My bf and I were extremely upset and walked out. Nothing but a waste of time -_- I can honestly say you ruined our night!
Tried the new spicy Korean BBQ pizza.  It is one of my new favorites!  I hope it stays on the menu.
Killer pizzas and other food. The outdoor patio is nice late evening once the sun goes down. Great service and staff.

Nothing particular remarkable -- its CPK... if you've been to one, you've been to them all.  Good for kids.  If you are looking for 'alternative' style pizzas, it's good.  If you are looking for a more classic pizza, Fresh Brothers in the same complex is probably better.
The spiced Moroccan chicken salad is pretty awesome.  All the flavors melded together well.

Today, I tried  the wild mushroom pizza and the small asparagus and arugula salad. Very good. It's pizza the CPK way.  Always a good  place for a quick  lunch meeting. And by the way, they will always try to accommodate you if you want something not specifically on the menu, such as a different topping, sauce or dressing. And their vegan / vegetarian menus are good.

Excellent food! Yesterday I tried their mushroom cheese pizza, WOW it was delicious...  My family and I love to eat at CPK, but location is one of the best. The bread here is always fresh and fast customer service.
Spring rolls were a great addition this time

CPK has been experimenting with their menu for quite a while. I know this from someone from corporate and I have to admit, they are getting better. The cocktails are much more interesting and fun.  And the meal portions are nice, without straying from its original positioning.  I love the Chicken BBQ Pizza!

Sat at the bar so I got to see them cook everything, I ordered the chicken Caesar salad and recieved a tortilla soup Finally got the salad which was pretty good.  The one star is for what I saw when I was at the bar.  Some poor lady ordered this shrimp to go and I saw the guy in the back with 8 shrimps on a stick and he pull them down off the stick with his hands Into the to-go box, and he droped two or three onto a CLEARLY dirty towel that I saw him wipe his head sweat off with and has black marks that I think came from him wiping his grill or something. After the shrimp fell and landed on the towel, he grabed them all with one hand and threw them in the box(I assumed it was for someone working there)  I saw them box it up and put it in a bag and then handed it to a lady who was at the to-go side. Thats disgusting but I guess that's what happens when you see the "behind the scene" side. Nevertheless I'm never going here again with dirty sloppy handling of your food. Gross.

I used to love this place . . .now, not so much. The service is mediocre and the food is just ok. They do have a nice patio area, but the service out there seems slower. Sorry, CPK, you just arent cutting it these days.

So how can you go to California and not go to CPK, right?  Ha!  Well, it certainly wasn't our intention to eat here, but we didn't realize that there weren't a whole lot of other options in Marina del Rey.  We went to Marina del Rey to see the fireworks on the 4th of July, which were a huge disappointment, but that's a whole other story.  Let's just say that being from St. Louis, we know what a real fireworks display looks like.  Anyway, we walked around for a while and couldn't decide on a place to eat.  We happened upon CPK, which was right next to a burger joint, and we decided we didn't want a burger.  At this point, we were tired of walking around and settled for CPK. This was a nice CPK on the inside, and it was extremely busy.  We had about a 20 minute wait before we were seated.  Once seated, we received pretty decent service.  My wife and I each ordered a tea, mine a regular and hers a peach.  Who knew that peach tea was 50 cents more than regular tea?  Strange, but oh well.  For our food, we each ordered a pizza.  I got the BBQ chicken with bacon, while my wife just got a standard pepperoni pizza.  The food was good.  Nothing outstanding, but certainly good. Overall, I doubt we'll be back to this location, mainly because we found Marina del Ray to be very boring.  I'm sure we'll visit a CPK again, though.

I just had a terrible asian chicken salad there! not enough chicken and dressing,not taste at all! ROY a very RUDE manager!!! denied to replace the salad even when another manager said that I could have another one... I will never go back! there are so many others good places around that same area! TERRIBLE!!! food and attitude.

My family and I have been coming here for years and have loved it!  However, last night we agreed that we would be looking for another restaurant to meet at.  We have observed service getting worse at this location.  We were served the new bread with dip. The dip is good but the bread is very hard and cold. I ordered the tequila chicken pasta, which I have ordered in the past and loved!  Last night it had, literally, 8 very small pieces of chicken.  I recall the dish having much more chicken than that.  The service was underwhelming.  Maybe because we were considered a party of 8, even though three of the eight were children, and an 18% gratuity was added on whether her service was good or not.  Her service was worth 10% at the most. She acted as if she could have cared less.  Some one else brought our food and cleared our dishes. She never came back to see if we were doing okay. I would have ordered another glass of wine but never got the chance. We needed to-go boxes but couldn't get her attention. We asked a bus boy who was helpful. Too bad he wasn't getting 18% of our $200.00 bill.  I hope the management at CPK reminds their staff that a tip is not an entitlement.

The location and other mall businesses is the best part of this CPK.  It also happens to be 20-feet from The Counter, which is always a great option.  There's also a Pinkberry's, a See's Candy store, a Mendocino Farms, A Ralph's, and a Starbuck, among many other things.  As to the quality of the CPK, it's mediocre at best.  The corporate CPK flavors are all present, as is the general quality of the food.  The customer service is so-so, but not terrible.  Lastly, the cleanliness of the restaurant is C+ at best.
While I'm not a fan of restaurant chains the food at this location is consistently good as is the service.  It certainly outperforms the other big chain in Marina del Rey, Cheesecake Factory.

I cruised into CPK a few weeks ago with a friend - he just flew back to the states from Hawaii and we were grabbing dinner with his family before heading on our separate ways.  Now, the main thing for me with CPK is that the staff is friendly, the beers are flowing and my BBQ Chicken Pizza is cooked with love; so A+ for that.  However, I've been finding more and more that it's hard to impress me as a chain restaurant.  So, yes - it was good, but nothing exceptional that is urging me to come back.

CPK is just like any other chain restaurant in my mind. It's like TFIG or Applebees except this place had way more children in it than any other restaurant I've been to. With the said, this place isn't the worst but also not the best. The food was good, nothing spectacular but exactly what I expected.  I do like the location of the restaurant and the ample parking. That's a necessity in Los Angeles :)

Server overwhelmed. Salads underdressed. Portion of chicken too small and manager tried to explain their portioning method to me.  Surprise I'm a former manager of several cpk's so save your phony explanations for someone else.  Just listen - then apolgize and then make it right.  How about doing a proper line check and we wouldn't have these problems.  Table next to me is sending their food back bc it's cold.  What's up with this kitchen. My recommendation eat elsewhere. Funny- On my out of the restaurant the mgr was getting an earful bc someone's To go order was messed up.

Not that busy, but took 8 minutes to be noticed. Doesn't sound like long, but when you're hungry, to not even be acknowledged, it's about 6 minutes too long. Staff just seemed completely overwhelmed...it wasn't THAT busy...after reading similar reviews seems there may be a management issue.

Just ordered a full Waldorf chicken salad for curb side  pickup. I drove from Westchester to pick it up then all the way home to find not 1 piece of chicken in my salad. I called them immediately only to be put on hold for 15 minutes. Called back again and was on hold for another  10min. I don't have time for such unprofessional and disappointing crap. $15 and too much of my time wasted. Never again.

CPK is always a delight. Even the manager, Nicole, was a presence. She stopped by our table to inquire how everything was. In this day and age, that's almost unheard of. BIG kudos, to CPK and Nicole! CPK, continues  to add tasty items to their menu and I for one am a happy camper.  The Moroccan Chicken Salad is a salad lovers dream. It has texture, fiber, crunch, freshness and it's just simply delish! The Chicken Milanese over arugla was also quite good. I would definitely get these two again. CPK merits 4 stars for price, service, and a decent menu.

I've eaten at CPK 4 times in the past week and a half since I discovered they now have GLUTEN-FREE PIZZA CRUST!!! I'm allergic to gluten, and I was seriously missing pizza. I've found a few other pizza places with gluten-free crust, but it's often not very good and I have a hard time convincing my boyfriend to split one with me. But when we tried California Pizza Kitchen's new gluten-free crust, my boyfriend liked it even more than their regular crust! It's hands-down the best gluten-free crust I've ever had. What's amazing it's it's also gluten-free certified, which is rare to find in restaurants that serve gluten at all. The staff was also very well educated on gluten and its introduction to the restaurant in addition to being friendly and great servers/managers. I should also mention their food is just excellent to begin with. But now I'll keep coming back for their pizza. As far as the location, I love this one. There's plenty of parking and the restaurant itself is very nice. Try the gluten-free crust! You won't be disappointed!

I have been going to CPK since the beginning. My wife & I have our favorite dishes to order & we order them each time we go. We went again today and everything was different. My Grilled Veggie sandwich was on a much larger bun but had an insultingly small quantity of filling. Maybe 2 ounces of veggies or less. The Caesar Salad looked undressed but the guy overdressed it but failed to toss it. The Asparagus salad had one Asparagus, it was totally raw and they used the whole stalk so it was like eating rope. The pasta was tasty but served at just below room temperature. I was shocked at the downturn. Now I see the chain has new owners & they are cheapening things. I can't imagine returning.
Love this location!! Servers here are amazing and nothing bad ever happens here, nothing like the culver city location: marina del Rey you rock!!

Spent my birthday here once. Had a Vegan style pizza with gluten free crust, NO cheese, and all the veggies. It was cooked to perfection, and they use Chinese broccoli, which is heavenly.  If you are a Vegan, you could totally be comfortable here with the lettuce wrap (meatless version, of course). The water chestnuts give it a nice crunch, while the peanut sauce melts in your mouth. I ended the evening with an Apple Martini, perfectly sour, and perfectly chilled. Go for it!

Definitely will be coming back here! My picky 6 yr old wanted pizza so we came here and he loves it! And same goes for me. Got greeted at the door with the lady opening the door for us. The waiter was very nice and courteous. Definitely 2 thumbs up!

At all other CPK locations,  they don't charge me for extra pasta. They charged me for extra pasta here at this location.   When I picked up a to go order the other night, the amount of pasta in the box was the same size as a regular size pasta bowl. I know this because CPK is one of my favorite chain and I dine with them quite frequently.  I returned to the waiter and showed him the box of pasta and asked him I had ordered and paid for extra pasta. The waiter smiled at me and said that it is with extra pasta. I questioned him and asked if he was sure. He said Yes. :-(  I shared that pasta dish with my sister as always, and it was a disappointment amount.   The pasta was soggy and the flavor was bland, leaving us very disappointed. Unfortunately, I will not be returning to this location anytime soon.

As much as I usually like CPK I feel this location does not make their food to the standard of quality I'm used to getting at CPK. I've been to locations in Manhattan Beach, Redondo Beach, the CPK Express one in Redondo I think, and the Culver City one. This was the first time I ordered Thai Chicken Pizza and the White Corn Guacamole & Chips Small Plate at this location, although I've been here before and ordered other things. I order these a lot and know what they usually taste and look like. The Thai Chicken Pizza wasn't made very well, it had way too much veggies so that it overwhelmed the chicken and didn't have a balanced taste. I love vegetables so it wasn't that I dislike veggies but more the veggie/chicken/sauce ratio. The peanut sauce wasn't evenly spread, so I had bites oozing lots of sauce and bites that were very dry and sauceless. The White Corn Guac is one of my new favorites and is well executed at the Culver City location and looks just like it's picture, with lots of corn and small diced avocado and a balanced flavor. At this MDR location, instead of diced avocado it was large chunks and tasted overwhelmingly of jicama with barely any corn and also too much beans, so the flavor and texture profile was completely off. I mean seriously, how hard is it to dice something as soft as avocado. To me it just seems the kitchen staff is either extremely lazy or inexperienced because their lack of execution really shows and unfortunately made for a very rare disappointing dinner at CPK, one of my favorite restaurant chains.

For starters, anyone who has been to the plaza knows how parking can be. For those who don't - just know that you'll want to practice patience looking for parking while navigating around others who seem oblivious to the fact that they're holding up traffic and creating a log jam, in an already packed parking lot.  As for the restaurant, there's both indoor and outdoor seating. One the chillier nights, I've seen a lot of empty tables because no one want to be out in the cold when the marine layer starts creeping in. It's warmer and cozier indoors and you don't have to deal with the vehicular noise from the parking lot.  Then there's the service. On this visit, our server seemed to either be slow, or just didn't care to serve our table. I can't be sure which it was but to have to ask to be served, when I thought that's the primary function of the wait staff - just didn't calculate right for me. No follow up to check on how the dishes came out nor whether we wanted anything else. We also had to flag her down for the check after she walked by us several times, checking up on the tables around us.  The food was okay. I tried the Tequila Lime Fettucini and there definitely is a lime flavor. Too much in fact. It took away from the rest of the dish so keep that in mind and ask for less if you decided to try it yourself. If you like a heavy lime presence, then this is the dish for you. My family seemed to enjoy their orders. The only comment I heard was that the wild mushroom pizza could have used more mushroom, and possibly less cheese. I didn't try the other dishes on the table so I'll just leave it at that.  It's a chain restaurant so we should all know what to expect. On this occasion, my experience was okay though it might have been a little better had the service been better too.

Don't eat here much anymore so I don't know if this is the standard now, but the service was extremely slow, food wasn't coming out of the kitchen on pace, the food was bland, or not the right temperature ie too cold, etc, and the new breads on the sandwiches are stale versions compared to the previous breads they used and the salads weren't well tossed.   The Hostess was impersonal, the management didn't seem to keep the crew on pace, etc..  They need to get their act together.  It wasn't well run.

The food I got here would have gagged a maggot. I think I just have a habit of ordering an undercooked pizza or something else that makes me sick. My wife tries to warn me to skip the place, but I'm a glutton for punishment.

We walked in for lunch on a Friday afternoon and we were met by a friendly host and then by a brunette behind the counter (red pants and a black shirt) who yelled, "mother $ucker!" when it appeared she banged her leg on something. Nice professionalism. The dumplings had a gelatinous peanut sauce and the wine was so flat that they couldn't even tell me when the bottle was opened.   Alex was the one saving grace here. He was our server at the bar and was incredibly friendly and very professional. He's likely the only reason we stayed and the only reason we'd come back vs heading to sushi, pizza or another restaurant in the same parking lot.
Would have given it a 4 star rating if the waitresses had a personality lol Grest gluten free pizza omg I loved it!

Fast seating on a Sunday night, yay! Our server was friendly and approachable, but appeared perhaps either overwhelmed or spread to thin with coverage, as there were large delays between check ups, refills, etc. While my stuffed chile relleno looked tasty, it arrived to my table, cold. Cold cold. My friend's pizzas were also not hot, just bordering on warm, but didn't want to wait longer for their food and said it was tasty. My husband's thai pizza was abundant in peanut sauce as a base, so he was happy. It took six minutes to find our server and tell him the dish was cold. Thankfully the new one arrived much faster and hotter than the first, and it was a decent execution of a stuffed pepper. Nothing super impressive about the dish, but certainly edible and for under 650 calories, worth trying.  Drinks commonly stayed empty until we would flag our server for a refill.  Glad I tried this location since it's close to my house, but most likely not returning unless in a pinch for places to eat.

This was the worst service I've had in the 25 years I've been to the restaurant.  The server put cold wine into a hot glass that came directly from the dish washer.  The server had the nerve to say she didn't realize she wasn't supposed to do that.  The lettuce wrap filling was cold.  The sever refused to check on our order.  We were asked 5 separate times what kind of pizza we ordered.  We were forced to wait 10 minutes just for our check.  The quality of service decreased while the price of everything on the menu increased $3 - $5 dollars per item in less than a year.  This is a business, not a social engineering project.

I've been a patron of CPK for as long as I can remember,  I even worked at one of their locations.  I'm a little perplexed how to sum up my experience. I have kids, I try very hard to keep them in their seat when we are eating, the older kid is a pro while my youngest isn't noisy but he's curious.  He won't go up to people and pull their hair but he does like to look out the window and play. The hostess was having none of my kid's shenanigans, while he stood on the bench seat, she told me that this was not allowed. We were just seated. Christ! Give me a second to put my things down, and talk to my kids to remind them to behave.  On another visit, the waiter was giving us horrible service, no drinks until I had to flag a buser for our ordered drinks.  Our waiter was too just flirting with the table two over to bring us the drinks ordered several minutes ago. Lots of families live in the area, if you aren't nice to the youngest patron, what makes you think we'd pay to eat there.  Lots of restaurants in the area. Food is excellent but the service is poor.

I have eaten in this location for the past 15 years. About three years ago I noticed the quality of the food had just gone downhill and and the cleanliness of cutlery, glasses and china was awful. I was constantly sending them back because they were dirty.  For the past three years I had been frequenting the Manhattan Beach location instead and was very happy with them. I found out that one of my favorite managers from Manhattan Beach was transferred to Marina Del Rey and so my wife and I decided to try the Marina location again. Whenever our favorite manager was there we had clean place settings and good hot food. When she is not there everything goes back to the way it used to be....BAD. My wife and I went there again today for dinner. We sat at the bar and I asked for a water and my wife for a pink lemonade. When the drinks arrived my wife's glass had lipstick all around the rim and my glass had some black gooey substance sticking to the outside. I was so turned off that I was not even prepared to try and eat there. If they cannot give you a clean glass, goodness knows what else is dirty. I called the restaurant some 25 minutes later to speak with their manager. I was kept on hold for over 9 minutes without anyone coming back on the line to tell me they were getting the manager. He finally came to the phone and was apologetic for what had happened. Being apologetic is one thing and of course appreciated but it would be so much better if they could get their restaurant back to a level where one would want to eat there. My advice, don't go there. There are plenty of other CPK's that do what they are supposed to do. Clean place settings and good hot food.

From the times Ive been here the service has been pretty average.  No real complaints but my expectations have never been exceeded either... its a CPK it is what it is. People must like it, its been around for a long time. I think people come here because hey know what to expect, they know what they like etc. Not much on the menu as far as what I feel are good food options but I do like the Guac and chips starter and the Grilled Veggie salad. It would be great if they carried some better, tastier, healthy options but it is what you would expect from a chain restaurant.

Went to CPK for business and it was a terrific experience.  From the doors getting opened for you and all of the servers being prompt, courteous and not making you feel rushed.  We had the spinach artichoke dip which had really good flavor along with the Avocado Club Egg roles.  Those were really good.   We had the California club sandwich on the parmisean bread with added veggies.  Terrific!  Everyone ordered an assorted array of different pizzas and all were cooked with a nice crust and tasty as well.  First time in a long time I had been to CPK for lunch.  Needless to say, I will come back again.  To bad this place was not right on the water  :)

I think I've already done a review for CPK in Manhattan Beach but the one here in Marina del Rey is the one we go to most often. These two locations are very interchangeable to us. The quality of the food and service being consistently well above average. But I think in terms of what CPK offers they get things very right. The appetizers pair very well with the entrées which pair very well with the desserts. There is enough variety in all categories that we can always find something that suits whatever mood we're in. And then maybe the most difficult thing is to not offer so many things that it makes it too difficult for someone to decide. And the same can be said for having such a large menu that it makes it too large a task for the kitchen to deliver on the consistency that we really value. These two CPK's truly deliver.

Came here last night with my brother as well as 2 of my mom's friends where we celebrated my brother's b-day. Our waitress was super sweet, food came out at a good rate, and everything about our experience was amazing, will be sure to come back!

Today I went and orders the Kung Pao spaghetti with chicken, no peanuts Well let's just say "where was the chicken?" There was hardly any chicken in the pasta, and I paid extra for chicken. Depending on which CPK you go to this dish is a hit or a miss. Certainly not worth $14 to have pasta and no meat. Waste of money.

CPK is my all time favorite restaurant and I was horribly let down by coming to this particular one. Horrible service frm the moment we walked in. We ordered to go, the got our order wrong twice! It took a very long time to get our original order and almost twice as long to get the correct order, we asked for bread which was cold and hard, when we asked for different bread we were yet again served cold and not bread. Not a fan and will not be returning.

I had a digital award on my phone from CPK, so we decided to go and see if we had won anything. When we arrived there were a few people already waiting but it didn't look like a long wait. I requested a booth ,we were 3rd on the list, so we sat down and waited and waited and waited. The staff were taking people that had come 10 to 15 minutes after us and we sat. There was an empty booth 10 feet away that was empty the whole time. Finally, I figured that they had just overlooked us, so I inquired about the empty booth. The greeter replied, "I don't want to give out that booth because the waiter is overwhelmed with his job." OK we waited some more. Finally we are seated in one of their small booths - uncomfortable. I don't say anything. We waited and waited some more. Finally the server comes, she is nice and apologizes. I order a Banana daiquiri, after a long wait and two tries at the bar, she returns with a Strawberry daiquiri. I accept it, figuring I will be a great grandfather again before i see the correct order. We get our food and after a few minutes we get our bread. Yikes! So, at the end of this lovely experience I call the manager to see if we had won a prize from the Email they sent me. His reply,Oh! we don't have any of those left." He says if we what to go to another CPK and try them maybe they might have one. As we sat there other people that had been seated got so tired of waiting that they got up and left. I so wish we had done so, too. It is absolutely amazing that those in charge of running this operation have this level of disregard for customer service and complete incompetent, yet they still have their jobs.

We are here in forth of July, never had CPK before an loved the pizza! It took about 20 mins and considering the amount of people there that evening, that wasn't bad. Pizza was crispy, not greasy and perfectly seasoned. Last night we wanted to have that delicious pizza again (spinach and asparagus) so ordered from our local one (Santa Monica) and it was totally disgusting, this place has it right!!

The restaurant is in a shopping center. I was there for dinner. As soon as we were seated, we noticed that it was really dark in the restaurant. The lighting was a little too dim. The waitress was nice, but the service was super slow, so it was frustrating. The salad was dry & lacking dressing. Had to ask for extra dressing to add some flavor. I wished that the service had been a little faster.

Not gonna lie, the food here is really good... I got the waldorf salad & it was really good, not too much dressing just how I like it. The portion size was probably good for two even if I got the half size, so their serving sizes are pretty big.  My family & I shared the Wild mushroom pizza w/ truffle oil which was a $1.50 more but IF YOURE A MUSHROOM LOVER, i recommend getting that pizza w/ the truffle oil, trust me... its so good !!  so I mean overall the food is good its just the reason why I gave this place a 3 is because unlike the other CPK restaurants ive been too, this one has poor service.. I dont know if its the waitress we got but they weren't so attentive to us, our waitress didn't get my stepmoms order correct, they forgot to bring my sisters fettuccine sauce on the side... and our waitress basically looked like she was in a rush the whole time. I mean I get that it can get busy at times, but youre job as a waitress/waiter requires you to have the right customer service in a fast pace environment like cpk... well from what ive learned working in the food business.  Food is a plus !! just gotta work on the customer service :)

Good, easy food.  Great menu selections.  Miguel was a great server!  Good location. TVs are ok, but no SEC Network.  So limited college football menu. Hat flat bread special.  Arugula salad and shared siciliana pizza.  Yummmm Sat outside and wa s kind of grossed put by the tables.  Yuck.  Food slipped between the slats and stuff was growing on the bits.  Grossssss.  Should rethink slatted tables.

To start the food is great. Great menu with some creative pizzas. I love the habanero pulled pork pizza. Amazing. The food is five star worthy.  The service is the big downfall of this restaurant. I can only assume it's the managements fault as our server had way too many tables. I had to go to the bar for a refill! It was  impossible to get her during the course of our meal.  Be assured this not my first time receiving horrible service here. It was bad enough to prompt a poor review.  Overview.  Excellent food, poor service.  I will be back but I know what to expect.

CPKs is where we bike TO when we venture out for a bike ride.  Destination CPKs!!!  This is a great location, always good food, always seated quickly, great, great service.. I like! We always grab salads, this day i had the bbq chicken cobb salad, 1/2 order because it's plenty.  But before that i had a cup of tortilla soup with was different this time.  Was more like a bisque this time, not as flavorful as usual.. i seem to remember it being a little chunkier not so blended.. and the flavor (although i devoured every bit of it)

I've been coming to this CPK since 1992, and this is the most disorganized and dirtiest I've seen it. The glass door is filthy, the chair was wet when we sat down, the the booster seat was greasy, my wine glass had smudges all over, a server came to take our order after another server had already done so, and the food hasn't even arrived yet, so let's hope for the best. I shudder to think what condition the kitchen is in. Where am I, Chili's? No, I'm at CPK, and I've always had an expectation. It's not a Michelin star restaurant, but it's always had a certain level of standards. Wake up, management and understand that the people who frequent this strip mall will find this unacceptable and end their patronage.

We love Cpk pizza! We always get take out because it's such a good pizza to take home, watch tv and munch!  We always get the BBQ chicken pizza  and the Sicilian pizza add pineapple and bacon! When we're feeling healthy I get the chicken wardolf salad with no blue cheese.  We ate in ONCE and it wasn't great. Our water drinks came out like literally 2 mins before our pizza and you know pizzas take a while to cook.   Managers aren't that nice there. One time I came to pick up my pizza, I literally stood there for 10 mins before some one asked if I have been help. The take out guy was like "oh I thought my manager had already helped you" and You would think that because she saw me, didn't acknowledge me, took money out of the cashier and then walked away.... Another time I came to pick up pizzas, the manager was screaming at one of the host about her outfit. You know, in front of like 5 other guests waiting like myself.  But the pizza is sooo good!

Went to CPK during a weekday lunch with a few coworkers.  Appetizers For this, we ordered, artichoke dip. It came out warm with sides of chips. I quite liked it, and found I had to stop myself from eating and ruining my lunch. Entree Since they are famous for their pizza, i decided to get the white cheese pizza and added an additional topping of mushroom. I was quite pleased with it, not too crazy about the tomatoes, but it actually worked well together. It didn't overpower the plate. Portion Their pizza size is not too huge, but it will definitely fill you up, with maybe a little leftover. Sharing it may not be enough, but may work if you order an additional little side. Drinks They will refill your drinks (sodas/ ice teas/ etc). Service Out of the 6 of us, one of the order came out wrong. Our friend had to wait for about 10 minutes for his pizza to come out. He was quite patient about it, thankfully he's not the type to get hangry :) Other than that, our waiter though didn't completely ignore us, also didn't smother us with over attention. Also, the manager came a few time to make sure we are having a good dining experience.  Overall, for the price and experience, I wouldn't go back everyday, but it was a pretty good dining experience.

My boyfriend and I had dinner here. We were seated outside as it was a nice night, however the ladies next to us were quite annoying as they were very loud. There was another table with a screaming child all throughout dinner. The food was good, and I enjoyed it. The waiter was kind and attentive which was important. However, he was not very good on providing refills on our drinks.

Love this place. I've been a long time fan. Everyone is super nice at this location. The California veggie on wheat is my favorite with their classic chop salad. If you want dessert the red velvet or the butter cake is super dangerous. You can not take just one bite.  Gluten free items are growing. Only five pizzas right now guaranteed GF.

CPK, love the service, love the flavored Ice tea, love the salads. For a chain restaurant this place is very consistent and good.  I always ask for the patio under the heaters. Such a varied menu. If you have dietary restrictions they will accommodate you, just ask. I use to take my dad and get stuff that wasn't even on the menu. Great place.  Their curb side pick up is great. You park in front, food comes out to you!!!

I first ate CPK in 1997 in Honolulu and was amazed at how new and different it was for a pizza chain. Back then Pizza Hut, Dominos, Little Caesars ruled the pizza universe and the times were changing. Then, over the years I've eaten it at various airport CPK Express locations and felt cheated from my first earlier impression. You see many of these California Pizza Express locations skimped on servings and served sub par less than mediocre Za.  I was left believing this chain had gone to the dogs. I do realize that CPK express in the airports were different from the sit down California Pizza Kitchens.    So we decided to have a go at this place the last night in LA as this location was near the airport. The place was packed with families and there was barely a table open. It was hopping to say the least.   We had ordered a bunch of items my brother ordered the Sicilian pizza.  My wife ordered the Thai crunch salad. I had a taste and it was a great medley of crunch, flavour and freshness. I ordered the fish tacos with avocado.  They were not the best ones I've eaten but were a solid 3.5/5.  For my daughter she got an order of mac n cheese which she was more than satisfied with.  Everything came out very well decorated an appetizing and we were extremely content with our meal. No one had complaints.  This was a surprise for me as I had negative feelings after eating all that airport cardboard pizza.  It was really a great experience.
Love this location! Beautiful restaurant in the heart of the marina with a friendly staff and great food. This location has a big bar!

This place just never disappoints!  The food is always very good and fresh and the staff hits it out of the park every time.  We were discussing how our family would be happy to eat dinner here every night. Of course, not the place I personally would choose for a date night, however, family night, every time.

Just had CPK delivered to my place of work. I ordered the thai crunch salad and, much to my surprise, it had CANNED chicken in it. I've ordered this salad at a dozen different CPKs, and this is the first time I've experienced this sort of thing. The chicken was rubbery and slimy and tasted awful! I wasn't even able to finish the salad.

CHECK YOUR BANK ACCOUNT STATEMENTS after you go to this restaurant!!!!!  On 1/22 my 3 friends and I went to this location (Manhatten Beach) as we have gone several times in the past. Dinner was good, everything seemed fine. When the bill came, we split the amount 4 ways, the total for us all was $35 per person (which included tax & tip) 2 paid cash while the other two of us paid with our debit. I told the waiter to charge the two cards $35 each, the rest was cash and the change was his tip (20% because he seemed nice). He did that (So at least we thought). We left the restaurant everything was fine. Come a week later when I noticed on my bank account that I was charged $40. I called my friend who also had paid with a CC and the same thing happened to her. On January 30th, she called the restaurant and the manager, Walter Hastey, sure enough found the receipt. He emailed them to her for confirmation and we found out that not only had the waiter changed the amount, he had re-printed the receipt, and signed it as well! That was an extra $10 for our order plus committed forgery by signing our names! The manager, Walter Hastey, acknowledge the error to my friend and said that "the conversation with the waiter was going to be awkward" What about the customer who he committed fraud too??? Isn't that more awkward?? Yes it was only $5 each, but HE REPRINTED AND SIGNED OUR NAMES!!!!  How many times has this guy done it to customers before??????? He also said he would give both my friend and I a $30 Gift Card each for what we went through. Later that morning, I called the CPK Corporate offices (310-342-5000) to let them know what was going on at their establishment in Manhatten Beach, which I had to leave a message...twice!I received NO call back so later that evening I called the same manager , Walter Hastey, of restaurant my friend had spoken to, to ask what the outcome of the waiter was. At first he was NOT apologetic at all, he sounded bothered that I had called and he acknowledged that corporate had re routed the message to him. Keep in mind, I was one of the victims and he had never spoken to me before. When I told him it felt worse that I'm calling about the situation and he sounded bothered, he then changed his voice to sound like it mattered. He also told me that he was trying to make it right by sending us the gift cards like he told my friend(which he said would be put in the mail that night). He asked for my personal info so he can send mine directly to me (which now I dread giving it to him!) Well as of now, neither one of us has received anything! I'm not even sure to be honest that the waiter has been let go. he probably just got moved to another location! All I can say CHECK YOUR STATEMENTS FOR ANY PREVIOUS DINNING EXPERIENCES HERE! And as you can see, if there is any issues with CPK, neither the management nor corporate takes it seriously! GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE GUYS! I will be happily posting this to all CPK close to the area just incase the waiter was just moved to another restaurant location to make people aware of your company's business values and not let this happen to someone else again. CPK needs to teach their management that simple follow through will always help keep unsatisfied customers coming back. ESPECIALLY when fraud is involved by someone they hired!

So disappointed. Ordered curbside service online and when we got there even after their quoted ready time we still waited. They forgot the bread and cutlery but we did get napkins so that was interesting and no bread. Food was mediocre. Pasta was dry could've used much more sauce. I love CPK but this location lets down.

I had a lovely dinner tonight at the bar. The food was great. The server was very attentive and friendly. Jambalaya penne and the salted caramel pudding. This location has really stepped it up. As a bonus, the Lakers game was on and they won!
Always a solod, consistent bet every location I go.  I love their blt pizza that is no longer on the menu.  Always delicious.  Thank you for a womderful experience.
I was there last night to pick up my food I like the way the guy in braces pack my food he is always smiling and he always greets people keep the outstanding job Alex

We discovered that CPK has gluten free pizza!  Not only that, they are aware of cross-contamination which is something all celiacs are terrified of.  So nice for our daughter to be able to eat pizza at one of our go-to restaurants.  Another plus is their servers.  Naomi is amazing.

Talk about take out madness. Minus 1 star because it took forever to get our food. We ordered a pizza and 2 salads and then went to Ralph's to pick up some milk. Well we got back and they were not even close to being done.  Tip: call in your order ahead of time and do curbside pick up!!  Our favorites are the meat lovers pizza, the carne Assad pizza, and the Cobb salad. I've never actually eaten in so I can't comment on the table service or cleanliness. Parking is fairly simple. Drive around a few times if you don't see anything right away.  Great location near the marina and Chace park!

I recently dined at the Marina Del Rey location and was extremely impressed with the level of customer service that I received by a food server named Alexandra. Alexandra was attentive and was extremely knowledgable with the menu which made my decision making a whole lot easier. She was warm, genuine and truly seemed to care about her customers dining experience. If all food servers shared her positive attitude, there wouldn't be an empty chair in any food establishment! I really cannot say enough about this young lady. Her  customer service alone is the reason why my family and I will be back to this location! 5 *S*T*A*R*S* for service!! 4 *S*T*A*R*S*  for the food. They made some drastic changes to the menu and there is less of a selection. If you stick with the pizza you won't be disappointed. My chicken penne was slightly over cooked and just meh....Management was kind enough to replace it. I wish I could remember the manager on duty that night. He was just as delightful as Alex. Hopefully they will bring this chain restaurant  to what it once was, It would be a shame if they didn't..

My boyfriend and I went earlier today and honestly everytime I go it seems as though something is off. We got to a CPK in a different location often and the food there is always consistent and cooked well. His ravioli looked like soup and my spaghetti was missing ingredients, tastes different, and even some other pasta bits were in my pasta!! I am writing this from the bathroom because  my stomach is killing me!!! I had kungpao spaghetti with shrimp and I feel like I have the worst cramps or gas! Go to s different location.

I love CPK but I had a horrible experience here tonight. I am a a vegetarian and asked for a salad with chicken on the side for the person I was dining with. They brought us a salad they clearly hand picked the chicken out of and still left shreds of chicken in it. GROSS. Makes me question how they handle their food at all. The waitress was barely apologetic and the staff clearly was inspecting it as if we were lying. I didn't receive the drink I ordered till the end of the meal, again they were unapologetic. On our pizza I asked for half mushroom and same there was sausage clearly on it which I accidentally ate. If I were a more difficult customer I would have made a scene. I just think they should REALLY be more considerate about how they are serving their food. I'm leaving utterly disappointed that no one offered to comp anything or even a discount. I won't be returning and warn those with specific food needs (vegetarians and allergies) to beware of the lack of concern before choosing to dine here.

location: Playa del Rey, Los Angeles, CA
review: My boyfriend and I went here two Sundays ago for lunch. We walked in, and waited a good 5 minutes before someone finally came to seat us. Mind you there were 20 people running around, but no one bothered to seat us, or grab a hostess.  We finally got seated outside. Waited another 5 minutes to have our server finally approach us, put down the menus, and say, I will be right back. Didnt take a drink order or anything. We sat there for 5-10 minutes until I finally told my boyfriend that we were done and not eating there. We got up and left.  With all the competition out there, how are you going to allow a customer to wait an entire 15 minutes with essentially zero service. Everyone who works there seems lost and confused.  We got up left and had a delicious meal elsewhere. Wont be back!

Hugh was our server and he was amazing. They made Troy's first time to CPK very memorable. If you have not been before try it out. You get a free small plate/app.  The manager came by to make sure our experience was good and we like that.  Thanks for a great lunch!!
Server was nice but they took 30+ minutes for the food to arrive. Was in the area so decided to eat here but not will be seeking out this location in the future.

I came here a few weeks ago and I got to say that the service was amazing. The manager sat us down and kept checking on us to see how we were doing. Not only that but the waiter whom I can't remember his name, but he was great. This has been the most pleasant service I have had at any CPK. And also the food was great ;-)

Edgar was a great server!! Our three pizzas were wonderful---Sicilian, Chicken with spinach, artichokes and garlic, and California Veggie with goat cheese. I also had a California Crush cocktail. Tangy and refreshing! Finally, for dessert we three shared  a fresh, seasonal strawberry shortcake with Haagen Dazs vanilla ice cream and a slice of  key lime pie. Fabulous!!

My oh my! My FAV CPK in the LA area. Service is amazing and super fast (even @ lunch time as that's when I usually frequent). If you come during the week in the daytime ask for Hugh, service is impeccable! He truly knows what customer service means and is always recommending new things to try from the menu. During the evening ask for Priscilla (super friendly). I once experienced a problem with my food order and She immediately fixed it then a manager (Joey?) came over to apologize again and introduce himself. I have never experienced such consistent and great customer service in a restaurant before and this keeps me coming back.

We recently ordered from here to cater dinner at work. I ordered the cedar plank salmon and a Waldorf side salad. The salmon was awesome and the portion was just right. :) The salad was pretty great also and they have a gluten free option!!  Will be ordering this again next time !

Food came out as described in the menu. Friendly and efficient service. I let the server know that we we in a hurry and he had the food and check on the table for us in great time.  I will definitely be back for their roasted veggie salad.
Good pizzas for reasonable price!!! Try the curb side for pick up... Amazing & fast. Also, spinach & artichoke dip are worth to try.

The service was horrible. Marina was our server, and I don't think she smiled once while we were there. She seemed to have a huge attitude. As a server myself I try to give the server the benefit, but she ruined our experience. We couldn't get out of there sooner. She forgot our appetizer, didn't apologize just asked if we still wanted it. We had already finished our entrees. She sat it down, it was cold. We told her and she just took it back no apology no offer to make a new one.  Maybe she thought we were a waste of her time, because that's how she made us feel.  I won't stop going to CPK, I just would never sit with her again and wouldn't go back to this specific location. Management should remind her that as a server you're suppose to make a guests experience good so they come back and they tip  you! The Kung pao spaghetti was great!

The pasta here is so fresh and cooked perfectly al dente every single time we go.  I like the fettucine alfredo. It  is always good and the price is always right.  I have not yet had pizza from here but the salads dishes are consistently good.

We dined here back in May and had a very positive experience, we have since moved to the LA area and went back again for lunch.  Our waitress was very friendly and attentive.  Our food came out quickly and tasted great.  We each had a different type of pizza and enjoyed it.  We had the Red Velvet Cake and Strawberry Shortcake for dessert, it was delicious as usual. Now that we live in the area, we will likely be back to this establishment.

I used to come to the CPK often since it was closest to where I lived, let me just tell you my disappointment. Often times the food comes out cold or not fully cooked. I understand that I'm not signing up for fine dining but I still expect good quality. The one plus is the majority of the staff is really nice. My last visit there the waiter forgot about us for a long time as we waited for our check. I suggest going to  different CPK!
Bbq chicken salad is good. Great prices and menu is classic. Could use a bit of a shake up to keep innovating, but it's pretty good and has a lot of options.

Great location and very friendly, helpful staff. I want to give a higher rating and maybe we just ordered badly but everything was a little heavy. We shared an app of spinach dip and egg rolls between 3 and then a pizza and salad between 2 but ended up taking half of it home. It served for lunch next day but again, was a little rich for my tastes. Cocktails (alcoholic and non) were 5 star delish!

Last time I was here we were a big group,  our waitress had no patience and in several ocasions she responded agressively.  She forgot my friends beer and brought it when he was almost done. But the part that hit me the most is that in that place they serve water without even asking, how about the drought, there is a law for restaurants not to do that. I don't like wasting specially water these dry times.  Shame on you CPK.

They make some things well like some salads but how does a place with pizza in the name mess up pizza? I wanted a thin crust Margherita pizza. The picture looked awesome. What I got looked nothing like the picture and was ice cold. So disappointed it's ridiculous. Probably won't be back again.

This is a 3.5 star rating really, but I'm giving and extra 1/2 star for the lovely service we had from China and her trainer. CPKs are pretty bog standard with a good variety of pizza and American food. They just had a revamp and the place looks more open than it did before with tall bar tables at the back. Their special cocktail (it was a sangria with elderflower) was super delicious and I had a few of them. We ordered the spinach dip appetizer and the veggie roll appetizers. Spinach dip was good, quite cheesy, and the veggie egg rolls had a nice crunch to them. For lunch I split the salmon summer salad (had watermelon in it!) and the lobster flatbread. The lobster flatbread was more of an appetizer, but it had a lot of lobster on top of the flatbread so points for that. The summer salad was really good and I liked the creativity of the watermelon in it. The salmon in the salad was a bit overcooked.  I've been here before and I am going to stick with the pizzas here next time. Otherwise the rest of the food was good as usual and really enjoyed the banter with our servers.

I eat here frequently and usually have good service and great food ! But tonight went for a early dinner and was very disappointed with the service ! Our waiter was slow and couldn't care less . Had to wait forever for our drinks and food . Was with a three year old and didn't have all night . The manager did Handle it by comping the meal but they really need better waiters .

NOT what it used to be, the quality of the food has gone down, portions are smaller and service is, again, not what it used to be.  I used to say "when you go to CPK you never disappointed, always good quality food and service" was sad to see i was wrong when we visited it last week.

Service 5, Food 1. Question to the chef: Have you EVER had Real pizza? Italian pizza base supposed to be topped with tomato sauce, and then cheese. What arrived on my plate was not pizza. You might call it Californian cheese bread with gentle drizzle of tomato sauce (not even that!) but not pizza. I've looked at the other diners plates - same thing! False marketing and very disappointing waste of money. Wish I went to the supermarket down the street and bought a frozen one.

I know this is more of a chain but this particular location is different - From beginning to end, we had a great experience.  Must thank Monday night football for us coming in or we would have went somewhere else. Our hostess (Morghan) was super sweet - even though all she did was bring us to our table. She gave such a bright vibe that it really set up our evening. Shortly after seating Rocky greeted us. She was another lively individual who informed us that the menus were fairly new & it showed. The design and simplicity of the menu was very pleasing to look at. There's a lot on the menu but it didn't feel overwhelming at all.. It was organized, clean and made ordering very easy.  As for the food, we got the spinach and artichoke pizza w chicken added. BOMB I absolutely love the crispness of the crust and the flavors balance so well. (Definitely big enough to serve 2-3 people.) We couldn't gage how hungry we were so we also ordered two cups of soup: Baked potato & Farmers Market. HOLYYY, they were so darn good. I'm a big soup fan and it really hit the spot. Baked potato is more of a subtle soup but still good flavor. The Farmers Market, though... That was my favorite!! I'm hoping we can somehow recreate that at home.  Overall, very good experience. I'm usually sometimes reluctant to go into restaurants like these because you just never know if that particular location will live up to par or not. But this one did.  Bon appetite.

Went there for lunch. I can't believe how expensive CPK has become. We ordered a bowl of soup, a full salad and 1 ice tea and it was $40.00 out the door. The service was not so great either, the server looked overwhelmed and couldn't keep up in her station, other servers were having to help her out. We had to ask multiple times to get refill on our drinks, even when she was at our table cleaning up plates. The manager wasn't helping out either, he was helping move tables on the patio... While the server was drowning. I used to work for CPK and from how it used to be when Rick and Larry used to run it has changed dramatically, I appreciate the relaxed atmosphere but  the service shouldn't relax with it, especially if you are raising the prices. I remember how strict everything was and how the management had to do their table touches, and make sure customers were happy. And servers had to follow their 5 steps of service.  But I will say that the food is still good, the Italian chopped is amazing... however, I am not sure about all that new stuff that they are trying to push. I so sad that you got rid of the tiramisu... It was so good! Fist you get rid of the potato leak soup now the tiramisu? What's next BBQ chix pizza?  Very sad to see the direction CPK is going... :(

This CPK IS THE MOST RUDE CPK IVE BEEN TO, everytime I have been there, their hostesses and waiters/ managers mostly everyone I encountered are very snappy and are rude I wouldn't recommend anyone to this location.... They act like they hate their job and if they work in a restaurant acting in such a nasty way, whoever hired the workers should be ashamed.

Always a guaranteed delicious meal. I know no matter which location i go to, the food is going to be good and the servers are always nice :) The only issue we had, is they kinda forgot about us after we were seated. Also, some of the food we ordered never came out and no-one really checked in on us throughout the meal (we needed settings, napkins, water, etc).The manager wasn't very warm about the mistakes, but the server was a sweetheart so no harm in the end.

Been a customer of CPK for years and never get tired of their signature pizzas! The BBQ chicken pizza had always been my favorite. Next the white cheese pizza. For the salads the good old Waldorf salad with fetta cheese, grapes and chicken were my favorite. I like the whole concept of an upscale pizza restaurant. Lots of parking at this location. It's part of a shopping plaza so luckily it's farther away from Ralph's.

Yay!  I'm a fan!  So glad to have found this place after we've sworn off Settebello.      This CPK is close to two (2) nice theaters --  the AMC Marina Marketplace and Playa Vista's Cinemark.  CPK, with its relatively new menu, is a good place to go for dinner before a movie.  Again, I had the Asparagus+Spinach Spaghettini (also delicious here as it was in Woodland Hills).  And since it was our first visit, a small plate was on the house.  (Very nice of them.)  So we ordered the Arugula Salad--also delicious but not as delicious as a Forage's or Rustic Canyon's but delicious per se.  We ended our meal with the tasty Butter Cake with ice cream.  Highly recommended.  The reason I'm rating this 4 Stars instead of 5 is because the wine was a bit off.  Also, their ladies room had only two stalls.  They should have made it four (4) stalls when they thought of renovating this place.  (Btw, it's a nicely renovated place kinda like the one in Woodland Hills.) Service was nice and, oh! and parking is free.  This restaurant is in a shopping center that I did not know existed.  But I'm no shopper so that's no news.

Wow! The manager hooked it up with a history lesson and a bomb sunny side up pizza!!! That was not even all of it because he also gave us a free appetizer!!!! I truly recommend this place because I asked a random busser how long a personal pan pizza would take and he answered without hesitation. He even asked if I was on my lunch break, so he got us our drinks to make sure we were not late. Fuck yeah! Awesome service! The waitress hooked it up with delicious options to choose from! She knew her food! Go now! Bring your friends! Eat up and be merry!!
Melanie the new manager at CPK was outstanding.  I love CPK, staff are always polite and quick to serve.

Although we've been to this location before, parking can still be a challenge. However, hostess seated us right away. Clean, attentive and good service. Salads were fresh and delicious. Waldorf salad was better than expected and Brussels flatbread was authentic and satisfying. Most important was the engaging company in attendance!

It's CPK, so of course the food is tasty. My problem is with their curbside service. If I'm ordering curbside, it's because I'm in a hurry. When I placed my online order I requested a 7:30 pick up time. I arrived at 7:35 thinking they'll have it ready. The last time it took them over 10 min to bring out the order and I had to go in and get it. Well, as luck would have it, it's been 15 min and I'm going in to get my food. And even though I put my reward number in they didn't give me my credit. Since I don't have time to wait for a manager to come over so they can cancel and ring in the order again, I said to forget it. And yes, I'm typing all of this at the restaurant as I wait. Get it together CPK MDR!!!

Arugula and quinoa salad with chicken breast was so refreshing! You can also order it with salmon as well. Chicken was soft, tasty and warm.  Got the full portion but was a little too much for me. Half is just right. Good avocado spring rolls as well. Comes with two sauces. Preferred the orange one better.

My mother and I came here parched from walking aroundVenice for hours. Michael, or as he says his French name is Michae, was our server. He was very nice and entertaining until my mother got a little too inappropriate. The pizzas were decent and drinks were quite nice. My mother apparently had 2 too many drinks as she asked Michael to come home with her.  I mean, he's nice looking and all, but about 20 years too young for her. Any ways, overall nice experience. Good food. Excellent service. Great drinks.
Food is typical of CPK, but service is incredibly slow. Took almost 1/2 hour just for our non-alcoholic drinks. This is typical for this location

It will never cease to amaze me why people frequent CPK. On a whim we decided to grab a quick lunch here after a favorite of ours down the street was closed for the afternoon. We were ignored by the rather surly hostess upon arriving and just decided to find ourselves two spots at the bar. The bartender was nice but incredibly busy and ended up taking down our basic martini order wrong and bringing us something entirely different. The food was basic and needed seasoning. I had the chicken tequila fettuccine. The hubby had a bbq chicken sandwich. My pasta was cold and barely had any chicken. The hubby said his sandwich was boring. Also, CPK is definitely overpriced for what you get.

Very frustrating experience. Used curbside service. When I first got there, there were no open parking spaces. I called the restaurant ask them what their procedure is, when all the spots are taken. I was told by Edgar, I don't know. Let me transfer you to take out. The phone rang for 3 minutes and no one every answered. I drove around the parking lot 2x's before a spot opened. Once I parked, I noticed that there are 6 spots reserved for this and of the 6, I was the only one who actually was waiting for curbside service. The other cars were vacant. I spoke with the manager about it and all she did was shrug her shoulders and say, they must have gone inside. I asked her if she could enforce the rule that it is for patrons who are picking up food only. She didn't seem like she cared what I thought. Overall a terrible experience and I won't be going back.

Sorry that I can only give 2 stars for their salad and pasta. We tried Thai crunch salad and Kung pao spaghetti. The salad didn't get the taste of Thai and the grill chicken has no taste at all.
