For the Kung Pao spaghetti, my friend thought that if you mix the Kung Pao chicken and orange chicken with their chow main from Panda, the taste would be much better than this. LOL...

i'm very disappointed in this CPK. our server Raquel only came to our table three times. to take our order, when i specifically asked to speak to your server, and to drop off the check. We had to ask for water refills because we ate the whole meal with no refills. When our food came, we asked for peppers with our pizza and it didn't come at all. At the end when I got the check I asked again about the peppers and she said they ran out (Really?). Two stars just because it's CPK. otherwise, it would be less than two stars.

Sorry, only 2 stars; Ordered Garlic Cream Fettuccine. If you want a real creamy dish this may not be the one to order. My sauce was very watery the sauce does not coat the pasta it settles in the bottom of the pan. I was told this is how it is normally made. :(

Wow, what an experience. We have been going to CPK for over a decade and we arrive this evening for dinner. Everything is going well and then we get Edgar as our waiter. We order our drinks and dinner all at once. We are sitting waiting for our bread and dinner and 10 minutes pass , new people are seated and they are serviced right away and meal and drinks delivered promptly and we are still waiting ...15 minutes later we finally get our drinks, no food , no bread,.."more people are seated and served , we get our bread finally, 4 little pieces while others get a full plate of bread. Mind you we are being  patient , we even asked another waited for more bread and he was pleasant however never brought back bread. After seeing about 4 parties being seated and served enough was enough. I don't know what is going on with Edgar but he needs to be retrained immediately or CPK will definitely lose many customers. I have been a loyal customer for over a decade.  I advised the manager we were leaving due to the service and she was kind enough to comp our drinks. She remembered us because we are regulars. We left and came to Alejo's. It was night and day compared to CPK tonight . I will return to CPK because this was a one off however enjoying Alejo's right now. Great service, warm bread, nice wine !!

Chelsea was awesome!! friendly, personable, helpful, patient and vibrant. We will ask for her section every time we come here. Love this place try something everyday because everything is delicious. Aria and Michael are two of the most helpful, friendliest, and accommodating waiters. Matt the General Manager was very helpful showed great service.

Typical CPK but the service was great. I came late night and got the Thai Pizza which is a safe choice and got the butter cake for desert and was blown away by that. I am a fan of the overall cleanliness as well. Good chain restaurant food.

After getting seated with our table of six our wait person introduced himself "Bobby" and off we were to what was a great afternoon of fellowship with friends!  When it came time for us to place our order that is when things went down hill.  Bobby took our orders and upon completion placed them with a smile.  He read them back correct but the order arrived incorrectly to my hubby and myself.  We ordered the roasted garlic chicken with seasonal vegetables.  OUR simple request was for the chicken to come with crispy skin as we love that crunch you get with chicken.  Bobby brought my hubby and I the chicken picata with crispy fried skin.  HOW DID THAT HAPPEN?  We shook our heads no and off they went to "quickly" correct it.  Well the train had left the track as our guests ate and we dined on the bread and our drink while  the manager walked past us over a dozen times getting plates of food to everyone but not taking ownership of the situation.  She (the manager ... can't remember her name) did take control of the situation when we cancelled the order period.  That is when the train wreck occurred as her managerial skills were not working to diffuse the situation.  She approached our table with condescension and pretty much "demanding" we take it as they were not charging us.  After going back and forth, we were not charged (as stated) and took the food so as not to waste and she even sent us with a dessert.  Could it have been handled better?  Absolutely!  Will we be back?  Absolutely not. P.S.  The meal actually was not that good.

The worst service I've ever gotten at a CPK, but not the worst service I've EVER gotten.  Newly remodeled, but can I say that the layout is awkward AF?? There's a little bottom annex area with tables and booths that is separated from what I assume is the main dining area - the annex is where I was seated. It was beautiful and well lit, but the waiter in charge of our table looked like he was struggling to attend to the people sitting above us in the main dining area and us at the same time, as he had to go around a long wall.  First off, we weren't given bread. Who does that. I come to CPK expecting bread immediately. Didn't realize this until halfway through my meal when I finally pinpointed why I was feeling empty during the initial seating.  Second of all, it took almost 15 minutes to get crushed red pepper for my pizza. I'm sorry, but there are maybe 10 occupied tables and among 4 waiters manning the floor, it took you that long to bring red pepper flakes? I was halfway done with my pizza when they finally came.  Overall, not a great experience. The pizza was standard, and my waiter wouldn't look me in the eyes or show emotion on his face. Probably will hit up Fresh Brothers next time I decide to get pizza in my life in this area.
Way better than I remembered and much better than you probably think. My mother-in-law dragged me to CPK... It's great! Get the Thai chicken pizza.
Solid. Its like all the other restaurants in its class. Good tasty food that isnt too far outside of the bubble, yet tasty enough that you dont feel like youre in a chain.

Worst worst worst service I've experienced in my entire life. Order wasn't placed and 45 minutes later we were informed there was a computer glitch. My four year old son was soooooo hungry at this point. It was a sad sight to experience my son so hungry. My 4 month old baby had napped and before the food even came woke up so I of course didn't even get to enjoy my food. Besides the point it took years for husband to get the dressing for his salad. He was almost done with it before it finally came and we asked our server for it three times and finally asked someone else. Soooo horrible. Never coming here again. This would be zero stars if possible!

This place is very much MEH. I use to order there food to go in S.F and loved certain dishes, so once I moved to the area and saw a CPK was near, i was excited to try it out. Both time no one greeted us, and when they did it seemed like it was a chour for them.  1st time: they forgot my moms entree, but the guy took it off the bill at least.  The waiter was nice, but i think just over worked so we had little attention. 2nd time: Waiter didn't really help us with anything. Took about 20min to get my drink, and then didn't ask what we wanted to eat. Strange. So i had to grab him when he walked by, which was seldom. He didn't check in even once during out meal, in the end we had to walk to him to get the check in order to leave. Not the end of the world stuff, but also pretty easy stuff to change on there end. Weird vibes there.

I've been to this CPK many times.  I find the service to be very good.  Always greeted at the door, seated where I prefer, and feel taken care of.  I'm always impressed that the food is so good when this is a chain.   My favorites are tequila chicken pasta, chicken lettuce wraps, most any pizza, most salads, yummy desserts, and good wine selection.  One thing I've noticed is that the "small plates" are now smaller and more expensive which makes me wonder what the point is.  Spend a few bucks more and get full sizes.  I would go to this place several times a week if I could.

Gotta give credit when credit is due. We dined in at this location- California pizza kitchen is one of my favorite restaurants! We had an amazing experience from the moment we walked in. Our server, Liam was one of the best servers I've had at CPK, he was very attentive and friendly. Our glasses were always full, food was brought out quickly... He was on point! The food was so delicious (as always) I got the tostada pizza- sounds a little weird, but by far my favorite thing on the menu.  Next time when we were in town, we will definitely stop in and dine again!

Yesterday my family and I decided to go have lunch there and the staff was great upon arrival but once we were seated and our server came things weren't as great...! His name was Marcus and he was the WORST server we've ever had...! He ignored us half the time we were there and we had to pretty much beg him to bring us our drinks  he was just really rude and that part of the experience was really disappointing...! I just hope that the restaurant has a talk with him and lets him know that he has to be fair and nice to everyone not just to the people her wants to be...

My friend and I came in on a Sunday at about 3:00 pm. After we were seated (at a table with no silverware), we waited about 15 minutes without a waiter coming by to offer us something to drink. We had to actually pull the hostess aside and ask her to send us a waiter. Once he arrived, he took our drink orders and we asked for bread. He didn't come back with it, so we asked an additional 3 times. We also had no idea who our actual server was because we had about 3 different ones who came to deliver food and take additional orders. Aside from having no silverware at the table, we only had a vinegar bottle. There was no accompanying olive oil bottle like there was on every other table. The manager actually dropped by our table and asked if he could take our vinegar from us in the middle of our meal. Once we finally got our food (2 salads), we had to ask for silverware to eat them with. The hostess was actually the one who brought us our salads which we thought was extremely strange. By the end of the meal we were just so confused. We didn't even know who our tip was going to since we had a total of about 5 different waiters and the hostess. We waited far too long for everything we ordered. Never had an experience like this at CPK before.

Wowzer. CPK has gone WAY downhill!   Service: really s l o w !  Food!: dry, salty, overcooked, cheap tasting!   Overpriced, overcooked, bad food.  We used to go here weekly.  Since they have "reimagined" their menu, we have only been disappointed with it!   Too bad.

Just like any other CPK taste-wise, but this restaurant is big! It's located in a cool plaza, so I liked that we were able to take a stroll in the plaza's boutiques and shops after eating at this CPK and digest our food. Our server, Thomas, was very nice, friendly, and attentive. We were initially seated inside, but per our request, we were able to move to an outside patio area. Loved that they were accommodating! We got the Original BBQ and the Works--both of which were good, just like at any other CPK. Thomas constantly refilled out lemonades too, which was awesome despite the large number of tables he was handling at the time. The great service made for a great time with good food!

I've been going to CPK since I was a kid, and I've always loved their food. They recently underwent a transformation, and it was a complete upgrade! CPK now has a more upscale and trendy vibe while still staying casual and family friendly.  Today, I shared the California veggie pizza with my lunch mate and had a Thai crunch salad for myself. The pizza came first, and to my surprise, it was lukewarm -- as if it had been sitting a while. CPK usually brings its pizza still sizzling from the oven, so I was disappointed that it had been left out and cooled down.  My thai crunch salad was awesome as usual. I never go to CPK without getting this salad. I love the complex textures from the edamame, peanuts, crispy lettuce, and wontons. The dressing is light but flavorful, just the way I like it! Overall, we had a positive experience. The staff was warm and friendly, and service was quick.
Got a togo order..wasn't super hungry. .but still great food and service will update my yelp. .the woman who helped me. ..have to get her name. .she was sooooo kind

I've been to this location a few times before and most recently after a concert at Chace park. Sat at the bar and could see the chefs making pizzas and the bartender mixing drinks.  There was a big TV screen on with soccer on. Our bartender was super friendly. I wanted to try the Sangria - they had white and red and I ended up getting the flight of three which was only $10.  I tried it and the red was probably the best one.  Didn't eat on this visit but the pizzas are usually pretty yummy. It was fun to see them cooking them.

I'm not a big fan of CPK but I do respect the establishment. The night began rough. TONYA the hostess, the first person of contact the "CPK" DIPLOMAT dropped the ball by forgetting she was working and allowed her personal feelings to get in the way of work. My date and I had an issue with the seating selection and requested alternative seating within the restaurant and Tonya stated with irritation in her voice and body language to support, " just find a table and I will bring the menus"....Wow!!!!! Our server was great and the manager was polite because she is supposed to put out fires....To top it off my dates salad was awful.... CPK do better...Customer service is the most important characteristic in a hot food market like LA.
Chicken was old and rubbery, couldn't eat it. Really bad service. The waitress lost our credit card. Food was bad! Never going back

I went there to order something to go for the lunch party a week ago, but they were unbelievably mean to me. I'm not a native English speaker, so I was trying to understand what a girl at the take out cashir said. Then a guy next to her laughed at me and answered to cashir's questions before I get what she meant all the time. Finally I told him not to answer to her questions since it was MY order. Is that how they treat their customers? No way! They don't even worth a one star.

We had  avocado corn salsa w chips Tortilla spring rolls Roasted chicken w potatoes Chicken Milanese w arugula Split pea soup Wedge salad Everything was fresh and tasty. The chicken Milanese was the best of the bunch.  Service was on the slow side, especially considering that the place was half empty on a late Thursday afternoon.

Under new management as of this summer--Bummer. What used to be a fine place now has served us twice on dirty plates (hair on only one plate one time--could be worse I guess), partially heated up food on ice cold plates, and argumentative middle management. Too bad that we'll be taking the Marina del Rey CPK off our favorites list for good.

We ordered food from this CPK using Door Dash last evening.  The lettuce in the Caesar salad was aged, and both orders of salmon were burned and tremendously over salted. The food here has been declining for a while now, so this closes it out.

Used to love California Pizza until I found a pubic hair in my daughters pasta. The waitress was apologetic and didnt charge us for the kids meal, but our appetite was totally gone.  No one wants pasta with a side of pubic hair!  So gross and makes me question what the cooks are doing in the back.

I don't go to this restaurant very often but was in a pinch for time and nearby. I stopped in to order a large Chinese chicken salad.  The staff was nice enough to accommodate the change from a small salad to a large salad.  However, I ended up with very burnt chicken. when I first opened the package I thought the chicken were the wontons  very disappointed I am still hungry as it was inedible.  Spoke with the manager Rodney, and he's going to send me a gift certificate or something. Does not make up for the fact that I paid cash  was unable to return the salad for refund.  Disappointment. Always check your to-go orders lesson learned.  it'll probably be another two years before I'll go back for their overpriced menu.

Spinach Artichoke Dip and chips were disappointing.  2 stars Chicken Melanses was tasty 3.5 stars Service was excellent 4 stars Ice tea was tastily but expensive  Value was 3 stars. much too pricey for what was delivered Not compelled to return Jack H Playa Vista

I am a big stickler for Customer service, and all I got at this location was dis-service! Wait staff didn't care, spoke to manager and she had an attitude. I don't care if the food in the place was to die for, I wouldn't go back to the Marina location if these people paid me. A secret shopper needs to pay a visit here. Unbelievably poor service and attitudes. Way to go CPK!

Dissapointed with food quality. Cheeze, sauce an chicken were skimpy on both pizzas.  Salads not as generous as in the past.  Had to sit with cooling pizza while mistake on order was corrected.  Not at all as good as our past experience with CPK.

I love it here!!! The staff is super friendly and always gets our food to us in a timely order!! Their drinks are always really good. We usually get the salmon and a classic pizza. Always a solid dinner spot

I placed a takeout order earlier this afternoon. A full roasted veggie salad with chicken, my usual order. It was my first time trying this location. When I got home, I could barely swallow my first bite. It was INCREDIBLY salty. So I drove all the way back to the restaurant to demand a refund for my uneaten, salty salad. The manager, Urtha (I think), was rather unapologetic. She said someone in the afternoon shift made a bad batch of stressing, granted me a refund, and sent me on my way. I'll have to tell work about my bad experience (we order their catering every so often). CPK, you've lost a loyal customer.

CPK needs to spend time and money training the servers. Twice now a group of us has ordered dinner and for most of us water. The server shows up at the side of the table and expects us to call out and identify what the person closest sees rather than the server using a system such as numbering us or using an alphabetical list matching up the order with the customer. Example, A - in front of me, B- 1st person to the left, etc. To give another example of the poor (but friendly) service, the waiter just left the water and other drinks for the ten of us at the end of the table. I asked that one of the glasses of water be passed down, was flat instead of the sparkling water I had ordered, but how were my table mates to know which was which? I also have to say the dishes are sometimes good, sometimes not so good. The chicken in the lettuce wraps was off. The asparagus and arugula salad had only one stalk of asparagus chopped up into little quarter inch pieces. I am referring to the California Pizza Kitchen at 13345 Fiji Way, Marina del Rey and am merging two recent experiences there. The pizza was good, though.

Wound up here on Christmas Eve with my mother and brother. I grew up in Venice and we were visiting. My boyfriend and I have become recent fans of our local CPK in San Luis Obispo so thought why not. Choices were limited that night. Same menu. I ordered a cup of the smashed pea soup which I always like and the creamy garlic fettucini with added mushrooms which was also a favorite. Unfortunately this night the dish was not up to usual par that we get in SLO. The pasta was undercooked and dish was just warm. I ate some of it..didn't complain which I should have and paid for it. My brother and mom both ordered pizzas..my brother said the carnitas pizza was great and took it home WITH the side of sauce. My mom had no complaints about her cheese pizza. I told my brother about the incredible sangrias. I usually get the flight with Blood oranged subbed in..He got the blood orange one. Loved it. I for some reason didn't get the sangrias that night. Got something else but cannot remember what it was! Oh well! So I would suggest to this kitchen to double check that pasta cooking..was not pleasant at all!
Ordered food via Grubhub - website promised delivery within 35 mins (we are only a 5 min driving distance from the Fiji way location) - been 90 minutes and still waiting. Don't order from this place.

I love their small bites menu! Its perfect for a quick lunch and a beer. Got good service every time I have come, and while this particular location isn't in my neighborhood anymore, I don't believe it has changed much. One thing that I particularly likes here is that I was able to get in / out during my hour lunch. You can't do that at every restaurant!  The only bad thing here is the parking. But that really isn't CPK's fault but the locations.  - Bottom Line...you need lunch and in Marina Del Rey, come and eat here!

My family and I have been long time patrons of CPK. We usually frequent the locations in Encino and Glendale and the food is fresh and service always on point, seldom do we have any issues.  I went to this location recently because I was in the area.  We ordered a pizza and it was super salty! I let the server know and he tried to tell me that I was wrong, I told him we didn't want it and they made a new pizza.  The manager (female) of this location was initially snarky and unapologetic.  They made a new pizza that was super oily! I was dissappointed that this happened, but from the other reviews it looks like I am not the first person complaining that the food is salty and managment being rather condescending.  CPK please work on improving the food and most importantly the service at this location.

Great food. Not so great service. Our waiter sat us down, took our drink orders and then asked us if we were ready to order. We ordered our food and that was the last time we saw him. Not once did he come by to check up on us or to refill our waters or drinks. We had empty cups and because they had the heat on, it was unbearable. We were literally sweating. No water, no tea, no refills, no service, NO TIP.... Someone else ended up bringing us or food. Someone else asked us if we wanted boxes and someone else asked us if we wanted to order anything else. When it was time to pay, that's when he came around to ask us if we needed anything else. He smiled big and handed us our check. I looked at him and said, no tip for you. He is not a great waiter. Other than that, we love this restaurant and love the food and the other times we have eaten here, they have been delightful but the heat being on when it's 80 degrees outside and no refills or customer service made this particular experience horrible.
I think this place deserves more than 3 stars. Our server Sheridan was very attentive to us. Food was good and our order came right away. We love CPK we'll definitely come back.

Lindsay as a manager you're supposed to put out fires not create one nor a hostile uncomfortable menacing environment/atmosphere. Your tone body language accusations lies and defensive behavior was absolutely uncalled for.... and your threat to call security was classic of a young inexperienced victim mentality. This was embarrassing uncomfortable outrageous and unnecessary.  Grow up and do better leave your personal emotions at the door this CPK needs work. I will give corporate a call for you.  Be well and reconsider your role as a manger.

Coming here at dinner was probably a mistake, service was lacking due to being busy. They do have a descent menu that goes beyond pizza and offers soups, salads,apps and pasta dishes. My salad was descent, the salmon not the best quality. Soup overly salty as were most of the items we tried. You can tell the food is mass produced, it's missing freshness and spices. Not horrible, but I wouldn't bother to return.

History seems to repeat itself! Gave CPK a second... then a third... and then a fourth chance. Ironically, all of the outcomes were the same when ordering from a food delivery service. The food never came, or was 2 hours late!  Save yourself the trouble and go somewhere else.
This place is yummy, good food good drinks. But limit to 3 drinks sooo but you get your full 2 ounces!! Yeah im definitely coming back here. Lvoed it

This has to be the worst CPK in the entire chain. I have been a CPK customer for 30 years beginning with the one that used to be in the Golden Nugget in Las Vegas. I had so many service issues with the Marina location that I have been driving several miles out of my way to eat at the on in Culver City even though I can walk to the Marina location but tonight I decided to give the Marina another try. I am not going to get into all the details except to say how it ended. The waiter took away my son's main course to box it up and never brought back the box. When I asked him about it because we had waited for a long time after being ready to leave he said, "You said you didn't want it."  Huh? No apology, no offer to remake or take it off the bill, no nothing except a belligerent attitude. I hope the fleas of a thousand camels infest this hell hole of a place.
Going with the jamaican jerk chicken pizza on regular crust...Dummy fire! The lady is having creamy Fettuccini with shrimp...Such a experience...Oh and yes there will be butter cake.
I had the Margarita Pizza crust was burnt and didn't care for the chunky sause definitely not the traditional Margarita pizza. The Italian chopped salad is delicious though. Service is average.

The staff all around are very very good! I have eaten here since they opened in MDR  The quality of the food is good but my last visit shocked me when I pick up my regular order, Half a Cobb salad and the price is only recently almost the salad price as the whole one ‼ Could it be the Jacked up rent from Caruso  I do know the price is the same every where but  I no longer can pay your price anymore!! Back to making my own as well as the dressing ! Sorry CPK you too are now way overpriced ‼

Hadn't been to CPK in a few years.  Wow!  Has it gone downhill!  Took two hours to have a normal lunch because service and food prep was so ridiculously slow.  Ordered my old favorite, the Moroccan Chicken salad.  Tasted like the kitchen had used straight vegetable oil as the dressing.  Yuck.  Sent it back (timing mistake, as salad #2 arrived while my companions were finishing their desserts!)  Second salad was inundated with dried cranberries (why?) which was amusing since they were so stingy with the Marconi almonds -- I counted four.  And why the obviously canned beet bits?  For $11.99? Oh yes.  The dressing.  The original reason for send-back.  This time they gave the vegetable oil a "slight" acidity and called it "dressing" (notice emphasis on "slight.")  On reflection I still can't figure out what they did to the chicken to make it so rubbery.  I wonder if they bring it in pre-made and warm it (?) as it did NOT taste freshly made.   Sigh.  Another chain restaurant bites the dust.  So sad. . .

had a great meal at this.location earlier this week....and now at LAX Southwest terminal and sit down to order just to learn NO KIDS MENU.....really CPK? about to get on a flight with my 4 year old but i have to buy a full size $18 pepperoni pizza that he will never finish...all because there is NOT ONE kids option - in the Southwest terminal where there are tons of kids!! shame on you CPK.....i will think twice before visiting your neighborhood locations in the future.....
The vegetarian pizza is out of this world the tortilla soup is amazing you can always count on Fresh quality food.

Great service, great food. Have never been disappointed with a CPK yet, and I've tried them across the country (not that I'm looking for a disappointing CPK).  Tonight I ordered the BBQ chicken pizza, Wild mushroom pizza and Chipotle spicy chicken pizza,  all made in wheat bread and thin crust upon request, thanks to our generous server Liam. These portions were sufficient in dinner for five very hungry people. I also ordered the season special Watermelon mint martini and Honey bee lemonade. I couldn't get the martini in skinny, but it was super yum; even ordered a refill.    All the three pizzas were very tasty. The chipotle chicken pizza came with a cilantro lime dip that made it stand out among the three pizzas. I'd rank the bbq chicken pizza second simply for the love of bbq sauce.  On a Wednesday night, the crowd was light and we were out of there in tops an hour and fifteen.

I usually come to this CPK because it's close to home and service was good.  But today our server Isa was so rude and racist. I went in with my two toddlers and husband for lunch.  She would skip our table and go to the white people next to us and ask if they needed anything in a polite manner but wouldn't even ask if we needed anything.  She never offered us refills or if we needed anything. She was just chatting away with her coworkers. She finally brought us the bill after 10-15 minutes of waiting for her. It was just bad and slow service today. So sad to see how you can ignore someone that's the same race as you

I know going to California and getting this may not seem ideal to some like going to Texas and going to Texas Roadhouse but in my opinion why not visit in state if you love it.  My wife needs to eat gluten free and their pizza is always a good choice. This was the best California Pizza Kitchen we have ever been to. The gentlemen making the pizzas was top notch. I ordered the GF grilled chicken, scallions Pizza and my wife had the gf margarita and we split a Caesar salad. Had the most generous cheese serving we have had there and the crust was flawless. We have had at many different cities and this was far above. Do yourself a favor and try it out!

Not a good experience. The staff was not warm or friendly. Took forever to get someone to even acknowledge us. Seems like the staff is just standing around talking most of the time, and there doesn't seem to be much care for the customers or the service they are providing. The food was ok, but much better at other locations. I'll skip this Location next time I'm craving some CPK.

Too bad there isn't a 0 star option! By far the worst CPK. The staff have attitude. Had to wait forever for my food. Asked for bread & (with attitude) was told they are out! Wonder if they spit in my food when I asked them how much longer I have to wait! Won't make the mistake of wasting my $ there. Plenty of options in the area with much better service.

I noticed there are several negative reviews for this location but we have always had a great experience.  CPK is always a crowd pleaser for my kids and their friends, and also for me!  There's something for everyone, the food comes out fast,  and is always tasty and fresh.  I usually order the thai chicken pizza or a salad, and my kids get something off the kids menu.  There's a decent wine list as well, and lots of appetizer options.  We usually come here at least once a month and will continue to do so!

Food at CPK last night was ok, nothing special.  But the service by Marcus was horrendous. He never refilled our water, not even once, in the 1 1/2 hours that we were at CPK. He took our order without writing it down, then came back 5 minutes later and asked us to repeat our orders. When he served our food, 4 of the orders were right and the 5th was wrong.  If he can't remember what we ordered, why doesn't he write it down? He rarely came to our table, and never came back to ask if everything was ok or if we needed anything else. We had to request an extra order of bread 5 times before he finally delivered.  He explained that it was the kitchen still baking the bread, so I'm not sure who's fault that was, but nevertheless service was 1 out of 5 stars.

I called in an order this evening at 5:10pm for curbside pick-up as I usually do. No issues with the order, I even provided my rewards number. I arrived at 5:45pm and the representative had no record of my order. She proceeded to ask if I called the correct CPK. I pulled out my phone log to show her that I in fact had called the correct number. After checking a total of 3 times, she informed me there was no record of my order. After driving out of my way through terrible LA traffic, I left empty handed. On the way home, I called the number again, and they were able to find my order immediately!! What in the world is going on with CPK??? Very disappointed CPK.

I've actually been to this location 2 times this week with different friends!!! Both times I used the current coupon of getting one item free when another item for $15.00 is purchased. What a great deal! Both times, we have shared the pizza & salad. There are even leftovers for later on! I went to another location with another friend last weekend & had a good experience. I like this location because of the service & ease of nearby parking. All in all, another great experience at this location once again. :) :)

On July 12,2017 ate dinner at the MDR location. One good thing is the decor is lovely and then the rest is awful. I ordered whole grain pasta with my chicken.The waiter Anthony, should've known they didn't have it and told me right away. Some lady from the kitchen came out.Then my friend ordered halibut-but it was NOT halibut, it was sea bass! She is a chef and knows food. The waiter was way too chummy, more interested in making conversation with me and leaning over to me, than doing his job. Inappropriate. On the table were dishes left from appetizers, dirty napkins that weren't removed when he brought our dessert. My friend had to ask him to clean the table! We both had ice cream desserts which were partly melted. Never going back there !!!!!

The Gen Manager is a Racist .wont entertain u on an interview and I called nicely to follow up for my application he said I just don't want to give it to u.and take note I showed up too early to my 2 interviews ,  on a diff locations and he will just tell u their not hiring  and just don't want to give you a job when a person like me have a strong managerial Backgorund ,, wow what a dick.....

location: Playa del Rey, Los Angeles, CA
review: For the past three times my father and I have been here, we have gotten ignored by ALL of the wait stuff. We can never order, pay the bill or anything in a timely manner. Been going to this location for years, but now very disappointed in this location and their employees.

This was our first time visiting a California Pizza Kitchen.  The service was great and the food was pretty good.  I need to try it once more before I can give it a thorough review.  The location was great, but I didn't taste anything that was overwhelming.

We used to go to this location weekly, but I had forgotten why we stopped coming here.  Today I remembered why.  My family of five arrived shortly after 3pm, well after the lunch rush. Even though it didn't seem busy, it took a while for us to get seated and even though there seemed to be plenty of booths available they wanted to seat us in the back corner by the restrooms.  We asked to be sat at a different booth and they graciously agreed.  Our server Joey finally showed up with no friendly greeting or smile.  He brought us waters, little did we know that this would be our only glass as he never offered to refill our glasses. We ordered our food and again, even though the restaurant didn't seem busy it took a long time for the food to come.  We ordered two orders of the fettuccine with garlic cream sauce. When the orders arrived there was literally no sauce on the pasta. We were disappointed and asked Joey for extra sauce, he was clearly bothered by us and offered no apology.  Even though we had two orders he only brought out one small bowl of extra sauce, barely enough for one order. He never once asked us if everything was ok and never offered to refill our drinks.  He was a really lousy server.  And the food was only ok.

I'm a big pasta fan and I've got to tell you the quick service staff at the marina Delray location is just as perfect as the weather.we're going to be coming back many times. Get the lunch started here and enjoy!!

A quick run to Venice Beach today and back home tonight. The Marina restaurants are packed and a full parking lot means a wait. So we opted for CPK, a home town favorite. Sat immediately on the enclosed patio, the served appeared right now. Dinner order taken, soup (a vegetable market) very good. A creamy tomato base with plenty of vegetables, served piping hot I enjoyed the Tequila Chicken Spinach Linguini, I asked for the $5 shrimp add on. The flavor was mild no need for the lime with this tequila dish, I was glad I had ordered the extra shrimp the chicken portion was literally five chunks.  P ordered her usual mushroom pizza on thin crust with an alfradp sauce and a white truffle oil drizzle on the side. Nothing special here but a decent meal at a non crowded restaurant, just three stars. If you want real good go to the crowed place and enjoy the wait & meal too. foodguy-Martin

I have NO IDEA WHATSOEVER why this place is only rated 3 stars on Yelp! The food is great, the service is great, prices are okay, - but what do you expect in a place like this? - pretty much everything is great! I loved everything, and so did my family. Probably my favorite italian-ish place and Im definitely coming here again!!!

My daughter and I went to this location last week it was really busy we got seated within a few minutes. I ordered the salad with the strawberries and watermelon and it was epic. She ordered the macaroni and cheese about  1/4 of the way through I saw her pulling out what looked to me like stringing cheese from her mouth but it was a piece of string.  We notified the server and he quickly apologized and offered her something else. She ordered the same and they brought her a new one.  The manager came over and apologized as well and she explained it was a piece of the chefs coat. We finished up and when we got the check they charged us full rate for everything. I would expect to at least get the macaroni and cheese comped. Not sure of their policy I paid the bill and we moved on.  I emailed corporate the next morning and told them of the situation I also said don't send me anything free I just want to know your policy on these types of things. Well I've received no answer from them whatsoever and that really bums me out. So hence the reason for the low rating. I really don't think I'll be back.
Always busy but you get served quickly!  The wait time is never too long.  Hostess was pleasant and that's a plus

Spent a lovely afternoon at the Marina with the family and topped it off at CPK. Delicious food and the restaurant was clean and not busy(wed afternoon). The only hiccup was the waiter. His name started with a "J" I believe. He had a bad attitude, almost rude. Just didn't seem happy to be there. Besides that, all was good. If your in the area, stop by .

Good food! I like the membership program specially when you get a discount and or a freebie (depends on earned points). Curbside order is convenient too, just park and wait in the car   The only thing that I'm not crazy about is sometimes you have to wait for awhile (dine in), the service can be very slow, just like any other restaurants.

The food here is TASTY. Their Thai chicken pizza, roasted veggie salad, soups, and carne asada pizza are always awesome.  The service is BEYOND SLOW! Like painfully slow. So don't ever come in a rush or starving.  I saw the manager touch the salad toppings with her bare hands to make her own lunch. GROSS!!! It's an open kitchen!  Please get better because your food is tasty....

So i ordered my lunch for curbside pick up and it didn't go through. They had some issues with the system. So i had to wait much longer than i expected. The waiter came out and he was helpful, he rushed my order. Free lemonade is always good. I will be back. Im not sure i'll order curbside anymore though.

Came here just for the butter cake! We seated ourselves and as soon as we sat down we was greeted by a waiter who literally just finished eating his lunch. The service was great, the butter cake was amazing, however we ordered some drinks and they weren't as strong as we would have liked, but they were good. The only thing missing...happy hour!! I can't believe CPK doesn't have a happy hour. :/

Why is it that when pay for your food the same person you gave your money too is touching the food.   It's protocol to wash your hands and you don't even try to do it in front of the customer.   Not settling for it yes informed manager.   Got to watch everything now.

Just finished eating here with my friend. We usually like CPK But this location was something else. Our waitress Itzayana only came to us to drop off our food. We got heavy meals so we finished our drinks fast and we didn't get a refill until we were finished with our meals. My friend also asked her for water and that was never brought to her. At the end we were annoyed of her service and I'm sure she could tell but she was unapologetic and rude.

Kept me waiting even though I was ready. It wasn't too busy of a day and I felt as if I was ignored. I'll give benefit of the doubt because there might have been other reasons for the lack of immediate service.  They should tend to the needs of every individual more often instead of stopping at the same table, getting their order right even if they are halfway done with their meals. I stepped in for 15 minutes and continued to wait even when I asked for my server. I will assume the location here tends to be slower but some more effort should be put into the needs of all customers, not short stopping. Overall though the taste of CPK is fine. Had tried out their new chicken entree they were promoting and it wasn't too dry. 3 stars mainly for the service.

Called ahead and placed my to go order, only to show up when they said it would be ready and have the lady in takeout tell me my order wasn't in the system. I got no explanation or apology, she just asked if I wanted to place an order there at the counter. I then had to wait the entire duration for the food to be prepared as if I hadn't ever called in the order, and the employees gave no apology, but instead insinuated that it was my fault and that I must not have called in at all. Very frustrating.

Love getting the jambalaya linguini fini!!! It's not too spicy and it is filled with shrimps, crawfish and sausage. I like ordering it with the penne noodles but either way it is good and they give you plenty.

This is still my fave BBQ Chicken pizza place - always consistent. The Thai chicken salad had a good kick to it as well. Wine selection is always good along with the service and love the new stores going into the shopping center. Good place to shop and eat!!
New management brings lower quality.  Bar cut down to minimal choices.  Tito's and Grey Goose only choices and we hate both! Cutting back on quality guarantees we won't be back!

The California Pizza Kitchen in Marina del Rey is in a shopping center with a Ralph's, West Marine, Rainbow Health Foods, a Starbucks, See's Candy, the Counter, Sugarfish and other specialty stores. So it is always busy. There may be a bit of a wait during peak times but they have so many tables but it's usually not long. There is a huge parking lot but they share it with so many other places it can be tough getting a spot close.  I really like CPK.  My husband is not a fan (mostly because we've been there when it was busy and it's sometimes a bit loud for him) so I usually only go with friends.  Their Chopped Salad is always my go-to but they had my very favorite-their  Greek Salad (which I didn't see on the menu now though I haven't asked).  Their pizzas are wonderful also-especially since so many choices. I think anything you pick will be good.  I recommend this CPK. It has something for everybody on the menu

We come pretty often and have a few "go-to's" on the menu. Most notably we love the Chicken Tequila , Chipotle Chicken Pizza, Bolognese, Sante Fe Bowl, the Lettuce wrap appetizer, and the Baja Spring roll appetizer. Today we tried something new! My fiancée had the Smashed Chicken Meatball sandwich. The meatballs are made of a blend of chicken and sausage and  are served on a folded thin pizza. So flavorful! This is a new item on the menu and if you didn't try it you would be missing out. I had the "Works" pizza. This pizza has spicy sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms, and green peppers. It sounds a little boring but it is fantastic. The heat from the spicy sausage is balanced well with the veggies. And the pepperoni is extremely tasty!   I would recommend sitting at the bar if you can. The service here is way better and the bartenders are very friendly! Today we had Makuba. We have had her wait on us before and she even remembered us from our last visit! She has excellent customer service, even though she was bartending by herself tonight, with a full bar of seated customers.
Place is not all that, pizza is ok here but their entrees are salty and just average! Go to a real italian spot if u gonna go here.

I'm so disappointed in the service that we had tonight, Ifelt compelled to post a review. Here's the DL on how the night went: 6:30 Sit down at table 6:45 No waiter, no water, ask for waiter/server 6:55 Waiter finally arrives and says sorry for slow service and that a lot of things are broken. Really. 7:00Ask for bread (3 times) 7:10 Order 2 Chicken Milanese and one Garlic Cream Pasta with Chicken sauce on the side  7:40 Get lame excuse for waiter about food not being ready 7:45 Waiter says maybe chicken is done but pasta isn't because they made it wrong and had to remake 7:55 Ask for manager 8:00 Manager comes over and we tell her that our server is inefficient. Acts like she already knows and checks on food 8:10 inept server brings one chicken Milanese and two pastas. 8:15 Finally get all of the food 8:30 Not really hungry any more 8:35 Server gets big attitude 8:40 Manager comps Chicken dishes 8:45 Husband writes "nope" under tip...

We ordered the thin crust siciliano. Excellent. Opted for no ham and light on the salami. I would order it again and ask for more sauce. The waiter said that was his fav pizza. And I must say, at cpk, that is mine as well. Def get the bbq chopped salad. And def try the baked potato soup.

Awful!  That sums it up.  The service was so-so, but the quality of food is terrible now.  The chicken in the BBQ chicken salad seemed old and precooked for a while, and the flavor of the salad is different.  Others with me were unimpressed or criticizing as well.  The last time I was here I said I'd try once more, and now never again!

Everything here is OVERPRICED. You are paying for super average and mediocre food. I ordered the zucchini fettuccini, and there was more zucchini in it than there was pasta (the pasta was way undercooked too). Also, the plate they put it in is only like an inch from bottom to top, meaning you're paying 17 dollars for about 3 bites of food? NOT WORTH IT. Also, their pizza's crust is soft and not even as good as something as cheap as Little Caesar's pizza.

Party of 12. Wouldn't let us reserve. Was told "we don't take reservations."  Really?  5:30 on a Tuesday. The woman told us to come early. Out if town visitors ... not acceptable when we are coming in as such a large party. LOST OUR BUSINESS TO TONY Ps down the road and closer to the Ritz, our hotel. California Pizza Kitchen you need better rules and service. Very unbending and unhelpful. You lost our $500 check. Too bad for you.

This is a great pizza restaurant and I always orders the mushroom funghi pizza with truffle oil on the side. The pizza is thin crust and light so it isn't very filling . One of thee best appetizers I've gotten was the buffalo cauliflower with blue cheese. Oh my goodness, it was so good! Would definitely go back just for that and a Glass did wine.

Overall a good CPK in MDR when I need my BBQ chicken pizza kick.  CPK itself is ~4 star in my opinion with a good selection of pizzas, salads, and other delicious entrees. This location is no different as all of our items have come out consistently well prepared and to the standard we have grown accustomed to from CPK.  My only issue with this location to bring down to 3.5 stars is the significant inconsistency when it comes to service.  Several times we have been there now in which we will only see the server twice, to take order and then to deliver the bill. In the mean time, it was a struggle and we had to bother other staff members for requested items or drink refills.  Again, good place for large groups and family friendly, but would benefit from a little touch up with regards to attention to service.

I've been to other CPKs and have had good experiences but this location did not match the other locations experiences. The food was good but the service was so incredibly slow. I don't like to complain on yelp but just wanted to give the heads up. It was comical the service was so slow except that it wasn't since I spent $100 leaving pretty annoyed.
